title: Hello!
body: World!

title: Downloading Data as Separate Bed Files
body:
Hey Guys,

Neat tool, I really like the web interface and the clear explanation of the pipeline steps. 

I was wondering if it's possible to download all datasets for a category as separate bed files in a compressed folder. For instance, I want to download all TF ChIP peak regions from mouse liver. When using the data browser the default is to combine all peaks into a single bed file which seems...odd. I can probably figure out how to split the file based on track information in column 4, but this seems more complicated than it needs to be.

Let me know if I'm missing some feature.

Thanks,

Bryan

title: License missing :)
body: @inutano please add a License to your project.

title: Missing data for SRX2409974
body:
Hi,
I wanted to use data from your service, but stumbled over a problem when trying to download data for SRX2409974. Trying to understand why, it looks like the alignment failed. At least the alignment rate is 0%. Is this really correct? Or is it simply a processing error? I also do not understand how you can filter out 14% duplicates with 0% aligned reads? This results in 0 peaks. This is an Encode sample and their processing, admittedly different, comes out with ~64k peaks:
https://www.encodeproject.org/files/ENCFF169XNB/

If it is a processing error, it might be the case it happened for several samples... Could that be?

Another example is SRX083227 with 0.9% aligned reads, 28% duplicates and 3 peaks.

What do you think?

title: portal to database
body: I'm wondering if there's a way for us to access your database for a project we're working on. We're hoping your database exists in something like a sql database as we're running a shiny app, displaying ChIP-seq data in IGV. We would love to work with you on this. tagging @paul-shannon (with whom I'm working).

Hi,

I see that some of my GSM files have empty bigwig files. I just wanted to ask if there is a spesific region. (otherwise I will download raw fastqs and run through the same pipeline on my end).

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR THIS CRAZY VALUABLE DATABASE. Like If you guys hadnt processed this data, it would have gotten me analyse 150 chipseq files. I appreciate your work and effort!

```
how i install
cat interested_gsm-srx.txt  | parallel --verbose --col-sep "\t" -j10  "wget --no-check-certificate -O {1}.bigWig  http://dbarchive.biosciencedbc.jp/kyushu-u/hg19/eachData/bw/{2}.bw"
```

body:

Last month I have downloaded some ChIP-seq peak call data from your website, and have been using it since. I need to download the data again, but for some reason I get an error when I try to download some of the data. For example, if I try to download this bed file http://dbarchive.biosciencedbc.jp/kyushu-u/hg19/eachData/bed10/SRX670629.10.bed I get a 404 error. I also tried going to https://chip-atlas.org/view?id=SRX670629 and downloading the data there, but I also get a 404 error. Last month I was able to get this data with no problems. Do you know why this is the case? Thank you!

Best,
David Wu

title: Improvement Suggestions on Dataset Search
body:
Hello, 

I cant thank you enough for providing such a wonderful resource for everybody. Not only the processing part, data in your website is sometimes easier to search than GEO datasets.

I have couple suggestions for more accurate dataset search.

1) Could you add a search button to dataset search sections? Something results come up as I type also I live in canada so sometimes i dont know if the server is searching on the background or just frozen.
2) Could you maybe add a literal search option. My favorite proteins are AR and ER. But these almost exist in any word. 
3) Also search only in specific field such as Antigens maybe.

I unfortunately don't know how these can be implemented so forgive my ignorance if its already thought.

Best regards,

Tunc.

title: Updating old analysis - peak numbers per experiment very different?
body:
Updating an enrichment analysis prior to submission for publication, and I was very surprised that most results are very different.

Tracking it down, there is something odd when I compare the old saved results to the new ones - for any experiment in the chip-atlas dataset, the peak number is much lower - therefore, the overlap with my dataset is also much lower.

For example:

Old dataset:
SRX1161166	TFs and others	NR3C1	Breast	MCF-7	13463	21/758	2/758	-4.23037	-2.43098	10.5

New dataset:
SRX1161166	TFs and others	NR3C1	Breast	MCF-7	1848	0/758	0/758	0	0	inf

13463 peaks for the old dataset for this experiment vs 1848 in the new one - its a massive difference, and the overlaps are also wildly different (21 vs 0, all experiments).

All files follow the same trend with much fewer peaks than before - however, the files in the 'download' section of the website still correspond to the old dataset peak number. 

Let me know if you have a simple explanation. Same parameters with threshold at 50.

hg19 for everything, haven't checked if it affects hg38 as well

title: backend server not working lately
body:
Hi there,

I have been having problems redoing this enrichment analysis. First run with cellClass defined as Neural, no problem. recently, I reran the same analysis, no results yielded for all my peak set with the same setting. then I wanted to try with all cell types included, the script is shown as below, no results returned. would you help out here?

curl -X POST \
  -d "format=text" \
  -d "result=www" \
  -d "genome=hg38" \
  -d "antigenClass=TFs and others" \
  **### -d "cellClass=All cell types" \**
  -d "threshold=05" \
  -d "typeA=bed" \
  --data-urlencode "bedAFile@bed_Y_38_trajectory_regions.bed" \
  -d "typeB=bed" \
  --data-urlencode "bedBFile@bed_background_peaks.bed" \
  -d "permTime=1" \
  -d "title=bed_Y_38_trajectory_regions.bed_TFs and others"\
  -d "descriptionA=my data" \
  -d "descriptionB=random permutation 10 times" \
  -d "distanceUp=0" \
  -d "distanceDown=0" \
  https://ddbj.nig.ac.jp/wabi/chipatlas/ >> file_bed_Y_38_trajectory_regions.bed_TFs_and_others.txt

best, 
huihui

It looks GSE37589 is not included by the database. Is there any reason it is excluded? 

Sequencing data has been deposited to the National Center for Biotechnology Information GEO database (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/) under accession number [GSE37589](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE37589).

title: getting reads counts from bigWig file.
body:
Dear ChIP-atlas team,

Thank you for the dev and maintenance of this fantastic resource.

I was wondering if more details can be given regarding the bigWig files provided e.g. for this entry. It would be relevant for members of our laboratory to get the number of reads per position. I understand values are currently normalized.
https://chip-atlas.org/view?id=SRX018625

Could there be a way to infer the read counts from the normalized ones, using this bigWig file and recalling the normalization step?

Kind regards,
Ignacio

title: control file for TF ChIP
body:
Hi,

With MAC2, I assume you use something like this for peak calling:
```
macs2 callpeak -t experiment.bam -c input.bam (other parameters...)
```
and I'm looking for a way to have that `experiment.bam` vs `input.bam` relation for the TF ChIP-seq experiments, so that I could further analysis the data. Unfortunately I don't see any such one-to-one relationship in experimentList.tab or fileList.tab, or other places on the website. Could you help with this? Thank you very much.

Best,
Jiahao

title: How to combine data track
body:
Dear Team,
Thank you for developing the ChIP-Atlas.

I'm unable to perform a combined analysis and obtained a list of target genes. 
In particular, I'm looking for all the putative target genes of very unexplored TFs hetero-dimers in the human blood cell lines.

From ChIP-Atlas: Peak Browser I selected all the experimental conditions for the two TF of interest (human genome, ChIP from TFs, blood cell, threshold of 100, and the antigen protein of interest), visualizing the binding with IGV genome browser. Of course, if I select a particular gene I can see if there is a peak in the same position for both proteins. My problem is that I would like to obtain a list of the total genes of the genome with overlapped peaks for both proteins (possibly near the TSS). I tried with the "combined data track" tool in the IGV software, but it doesn't allow me to select the tracks. 

How can I perform this type of analysis? I tried also with ChIP-Atlas: Target Genes, selecting the distance of +/-1kb from TSS for both proteins, but I'm unable to obtain a list of genes.

Thank you for your support.

Best regards,
Veronica De Paolis

title: API return no results
body:
Dear Team,

Hope you are all doing well, I tried to use API to automatically conduct enrichment analysis for my gene lists. However after I posted my data, I didn't get any result.

Commands I used:

curl -X POST \
-d "format=text" \
-d "result=www" \
-d "genome=hg38" \
-d "antigenClass=TFs and others" \
-d "cellClass=All cell types" \
-d "threshold=50" \
-d "typeA=gene" \
--data-urlencode "bedAFile@test1.txt" \
-d "typeB=refseq" \
-d "bedBFile=empty" \
-d "permTime=1" \
-d "title=test_api" \
-d "descriptionA=test_set" \
-d "descriptionB=control" \
-d "distanceUp=50" \
-d "distanceDown=50" \
https://ddbj.nig.ac.jp/wabi/chipatlas/

Response I got:
requestId: wabi_chipatlas_2023-0206-0324-26-709-800611
parameters: null
current-time: 2023-02-06 03:28:54
start-time: 
current-state: 

Status page:
request-ID: wabi_chipatlas_2023-0206-0324-26-709-800611
status: not-found
current-time: 2023-02-06 03:47:36
system-info: 

I tried to check the status by using the returned requestId, the status page always shows "not-found", so I'm not sure which part I did wrong. Any advice for how to fix this would be very appreciate. 

Many thanks,

Zeyu

title: ChIP-Atlas v4 roadmap
body:
Genome assembly changes to save data storage

Major change ideas
- Add CUT&Tag sequencing?
  - https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-019-09982-5.pdf
- Additional organisms (`Arabidopsis thaliana`?)
  - Curation cost?
- New experiment filtering criteria?
  - gene KD/KO
  - diseases
  - treatment
- Chatbot-like data search
 
Minor fixes
- Navbar!!
- Typeahead to partial match
- Check job status by fetching the log file
- Show job details on the result page

Concerns
- Backing up the code in a reproducible way
- Web application refinement with a modern framework?

title: Get cell-tpe-specific TF-gene regulatory relations
body:
Hi there!

Thanks for the excellent work!

I am interested in getting  the cell-type-specific TF-gene regulations. However, in the taget gene module, I find that all the potential target genes are provided for a certain TF. In the Peak-Browser, the cell-type-specific TF ChIP-seq bed file can be downloaded. I tried to process the bed file via annotatePeak function of ChIPseeker package, while some errors always ocurred,indicating that 'start' or 'end' cannot contain NAs. 
 
Therefore, I was wondering if there is a more convenient way to get the cell-cell-specific TF-gene regulations according to all the cell-type-specific ChIP-seq data? 

I look forward to your reply. Thanks in advance for your time and help!

Best,
Scotty

title: Cannot find Separate Bed files
body:
Hello

thank you for this great resource! 

After inspecting the data I noticed that I am better off downloading separate bed files, selected based on the sample origin.
In fact, after having downloaded the assembled peaks, I noticed that the sample source is quite heterogeneous ( e.g. samples from healthy and diseased patients are assembled together) and it does not help me. 

I have been selecting the original bed files of interest upon manual filtering of the experimentList file and I was going to download them from

http://dbarchive.biosciencedbc.jp/kyushu-u/hg19/eachData/bed05/

however in this directory I cannot find the bed files I am looking for. 
Can you please help me?

This is the list of files I am interested in:

SRX8083175 | hg19 | ATAC-Seq | Blood | Naive B cells
SRX8083176 | hg19 | ATAC-Seq | Blood | Naive B cells
SRX8083177 | hg19 | ATAC-Seq | Blood | Naive B cells

Thank you for your help
Maria

title: Enrichment analysis hanging
body:
Hi,
First of all let me congratulate you and your team on a terrific resource, it is really user-friendly too. Now for the issue - I have been trying to run a couple of enrichment analyses of bed files and they have been hanging for > 12 hours. The analyses were estimated to take 16-17 mins each. Is there an issue with the server? The Request ID for one of them is 
wabi_chipatlas_2024-1028-1225-33-760-433954.

Thank you so much.

title: Download err
body: Hi. The Bw files of Bisulfite-Seq can not be dowoload, Can you check it? Thanks

title: Unable to Download
body:
Hi! I am try to download some peaks from the ChIP-Atlas peak browser and I unable to click Download BED file. I was able to download a bed file yesterday, but somehow I am unable to do so now. Is there anything that I need to do to get the bed file that I am not seeing? Thank you!
